actor_awards.notes: 40th President of the United States. Inducted into the National Cowboy & Western Heritage Museum's Hall of Great Western Performers in 1989. 'Kings Row' is widely considered his finest performance.

filmography.title: Kings Row
filmography.role_description: A cheerful playboy whose life is shattered when a sadistic surgeon amputates his legs, leading to his famous line, 'Where's the rest of me?'
filmography.plot: The dark secrets and scandals of a small Midwestern town are revealed through the lives of its young inhabitants.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Knute Rockne All American
filmography.role_description: A talented but ill-fated Notre Dame football player whose deathbed request inspires the team.
filmography.plot: The biography of legendary Notre Dame football coach Knute Rockne and his star player George Gipp.

filmography.title: Dark Victory
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, happy-go-lucky playboy and friend to the terminally ill protagonist.
filmography.plot: A hedonistic socialite discovers she has a brain tumor and decides to spend her remaining time living life to the fullest.

filmography.title: The Killers
filmography.role_description: A ruthless crime boss who orders a hit on a race car driver; Reagan's final film role and only villainous performance.
filmography.plot: Two hitmen investigate why their victim, a former race car driver, didn't try to run away when they came to kill him.

filmography.title: Bedtime for Bonzo
filmography.role_description: A psychology professor who attempts to teach human morals to a chimpanzee to prove a scientific theory.
filmography.plot: A professor raises a chimpanzee as a human child to show that environment is more important than heredity in determining character.

filmography.title: Santa Fe Trail
filmography.role_description: A young West Point graduate who clashes with abolitionist John Brown in the years leading up to the Civil War.
filmography.plot: West Point graduates Jeb Stuart and George Custer are stationed in Kansas, where they face off against the radical abolitionist John Brown.

filmography.title: The Hasty Heart
filmography.role_description: An American soldier recovering in a Burmese hospital who tries to befriend a dying, misanthropic Scottish soldier.
filmography.plot: Wounded soldiers in a World War II field hospital try to comfort a proud Scotsman who does not know he has only weeks to live.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Richard Todd)

filmography.title: Storm Warning
filmography.role_description: A courageous district attorney determined to bring the Ku Klux Klan to justice despite local fear and silence.
filmography.plot: A fashion model visiting her sister in a small Southern town witnesses a murder committed by the Ku Klux Klan.

filmography.title: Desperate Journey
filmography.role_description: A wisecracking American pilot in the RAF who helps his downed bomber crew escape Nazi Germany.
filmography.plot: After their bomber crashes in Germany, an Allied flight crew must fight their way across the country to safety.

filmography.title: This Is the Army
filmography.role_description: The son of a WWI veteran who stages a musical revue to boost morale for troops in WWII.
filmography.plot: A musical comedy showcasing the talents of American soldiers during World War II.

filmography.title: The Winning Team
filmography.role_description: The legendary major league baseball pitcher who struggles with epilepsy and alcoholism while pursuing his career.
filmography.plot: A biographical film about pitcher Grover Cleveland Alexander, who overcomes personal and physical hardships to lead the St. Louis Cardinals to the World Series.

filmography.title: Tennessee's Partner
filmography.role_description: A wandering cowboy who strikes up an unlikely friendship with a gambler in a gold-rush town.
filmography.plot: A professional gambler and a stranger become friends and rivals in a California mining town.

filmography.title: Brother Rat
filmography.role_description: A cadet at the Virginia Military Institute who tries to balance romance and military discipline.
filmography.plot: Three cadets at a military academy get into various scrapes involving girls, baseball, and exams.

filmography.title: Hellcats of the Navy
filmography.role_description: A submarine commander tasked with a dangerous mission to cut off Japanese supply lines.
filmography.plot: A US Navy submarine commander must chart a minefield in the Tsushima Strait during WWII to allow the fleet to attack.

filmography.title: Cattle Queen of Montana
filmography.role_description: A hired gun who initially appears to work for land grabbers but helps a woman reclaim her cattle.
filmography.plot: A woman fights to protect her father's cattle herd and land from Indians and corrupt rustlers in Montana.

filmography.title: The Voice of the Turtle
filmography.role_description: A soldier on leave in New York City who falls in love with an aspiring actress.
filmography.plot: A soldier on weekend leave in New York City is stood up by his date but finds romance with her friend instead.

filmography.title: Law and Order
filmography.role_description: A retired marshal who is forced to take up the badge again to clean up a lawless town.
filmography.plot: A marshal cleans up the town of Tombstone but retires to become a rancher, only to be pulled back into duty.

filmography.title: John Loves Mary
filmography.role_description: A returning GI who marries his buddy's British girlfriend to get her into the US, complicating his own engagement.
filmography.plot: A soldier marries his friend's English girlfriend to help her immigrate, but he hides the marriage from his own fiancée.

filmography.title: The Girl from Jones Beach
filmography.role_description: A commercial artist who discovers a beautiful schoolteacher and tries to model his 'perfect girl' after her.
filmography.plot: An artist tries to find a model who embodies the composite features of twelve different women.

filmography.title: Hong Kong
filmography.role_description: An ex-GI and adventurer in Hong Kong who tries to steal a valuable antique idol.
filmography.plot: An adventurer in Hong Kong plots to steal a valuable idol but falls in love with a missionary schoolteacher.

filmography.title: Stallion Road
filmography.role_description: A veterinarian and horse breeder who competes for the affections of a ranch owner.
filmography.plot: A veterinarian and a novelist compete for the love of a female horse rancher in California.

filmography.title: That Hagen Girl
filmography.role_description: A lawyer suspected of being the father of an illegitimate girl, whom he tries to help.
filmography.plot: A young woman is ostracized by her town because she is believed to be the illegitimate daughter of a local lawyer.

filmography.title: Louisa
filmography.role_description: An architect who becomes concerned when his mother starts dating two different men.
filmography.plot: A grandmother finds romance with two suitors, much to the chagrin of her son and family.

filmography.title: International Squadron
filmography.role_description: A reckless American stunt pilot who joins the RAF but struggles with discipline.
filmography.plot: An American stunt pilot joins the Royal Air Force but causes trouble with his irresponsible behavior until tragedy strikes.

filmography.title: Love Is on the Air
filmography.role_description: A radio announcer who gets into trouble for his outspoken views and uncovers a corruption scandal.
filmography.plot: A radio announcer gets demoted to a children's program but uses his platform to expose city corruption.

filmography.title: She's Working Her Way Through College
filmography.role_description: A college professor who helps a former burlesque dancer get an education.
filmography.plot: A burlesque dancer enrolls in college to write a play, causing a stir among the faculty and students.
